Space constraints: Each household will need enough roof space to accommodate the solar panels and the mounting system. However, many urban homes have smaller roofs or obstructions like trees or buildings.
Homeowners Association (HOA) approval: In many suburban communities, homeowners' associations (HOAs) may not allow the installation of solar panels, necessitating legal action and negotiation.

Installation challenges: The installation process can be complicated and may require professional installation services. Additionally, if installed improperly, it may lead to energy inefficiencies or malfunctions.
Aesthetic considerations: Solar panels can be visible and some communities have strict policies about the aesthetics of residential structures.
Maintenance and repair: Solar panels require regular cleaning and maintenance. Homeowners must be willing to invest in cleaning and maintenance to keep their solar panels functioning efficiently.
